what: A template used as a basis for developing R packages to my liking
title: A template used as a basis for developing R packages to my liking
text: goal packTemplate build example like build maintain R packages. hope integrate various parts ’d like ideally modern Continuous Integration, Continuous Development (CI/CD) approach R code. end, importantly aim cover: * Github actions checking package build * Automatic testing checks code test packages coverage checking * Git pre-commit operations enforce consistent styles formatting code * nice, modern logging approach * Automatic documentation site building example vignettes, new, readmes package website.

title: A template used as a basis for developing R packages to my liking
text: can install development version packTemplate like :
code: # You can install thhis package directly from github devtools::install_github("https://github.com/code-convenience-and-ideas/packTemplate.git")

title: A template used as a basis for developing R packages to my liking
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(packTemplate)  ## basic example code packTemplate::hello() #> [1] "Hello, world!" summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

code: local_folder_yaml <- system.file("extdata", "project_folder_structure.yaml",  package = "dataIngestFormatR") install_default_path <- here::here() load_and_prepare_yaml_template(local_folder_yaml, install_default_path) #> $data_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/data" #>  #> $manual_data_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/data/manual_data" #>  #> $processed_data_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/data/processed_data" #>  #> $raw_data_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/data/raw_data" #>  #> $summary_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/data/summaries_reports_synthesized_data" #>  #> $script_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/scripts" #>  #> $r_script_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/scripts/r" #>  #> $python_script_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/scripts/python" #>  #> $sql_script_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/scripts/sql" #>  #> $other_script_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/scripts/other" #>  #> $models_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/models" #>  #> $communications_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/communications" #>  #> $other_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/other" #>  #> $documentation_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/documentation" #>  #> $figures_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/figures" #>  #> $logs_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/logs" #>  #> $reports_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/reports" #>  #> $apps_dir #> [1] "/home/runner/work/dataIngestFormatR/dataIngestFormatR/apps" #>

code: # Simple example with a small, generic, yaml dataset default_path <- file.path("C:", "test") simple_data_update <- function(x) {x$test <- "value"; return(x)} test_yaml <- list(   "default_script_path" = NULL,   "datasets_to_load" = list(     list("name" = "dataset_one"),     list("name" = "dataset_two")   )  ) prepare_dataset_yaml(test_yaml, default_path, simple_data_update) #> $default_script_path #> [1] "C:/test" #>  #> $datasets_to_load #> $datasets_to_load$dataset_one #> $datasets_to_load$dataset_one$name #> [1] "dataset_one" #>  #>  #> $datasets_to_load$dataset_two #> $datasets_to_load$dataset_two$name #> [1] "dataset_two" #>  #>  #>  #> $test #> [1] "value" #>
